reaction: B expresses his anger with A's complaint to B.
B angrily points out that A chats frequently which also makes much noise.
appraisal: B thinks the noise made by A is annoying.
B thinks that A has no right to blame B for making noise as A is also used to making noise.
stimuli: A is used to slurping his coffee which makes some annoying noise (#4).
A accused B of tapping the pen on the desk (#3).
A accused B of making noise during the phone call (#5, #6).

reaction: B is happy for seeing his new radio earphone.
appraisal: B thinks he is so like this earphone.
stimuli: B finds his new radio earphone (#4).

reaction: B is happy to hear that A's plan is the same as B's one.
appraisal: B thinks it is great that A's plan is the same as his own.
stimuli: A's plan is the same as B's one (#7).

reaction: A has been happy about the good weather till now.
appraisal: A thinks the weather is comfortable for him.
stimuli: The weather is nice and warm (#1).
